name: Albabenshal

reviews.title: Inside Siwa
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful and the staff are elegant and respectful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager, Salama makes you feel that you are at home and is always ready to help make your time in Siwa special.
reviews.title: Review about sister hotel, AlbabenShal Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel sits In the center of Siwa Oasis built into a mountain and is unlike anyplace you could imagine. Each and every room is unique and large. All rooms are on different levels. The dining experience is fantastic and the best part of staying here. You eat your meals on the roof terrace overlooking Siwa. The fire burns in the evening to take the chill off. The food is sublime and so much of it. The waiters cannot do enough to please you. The chicken, the pita, the olives, the potatoes, the soups, vegetables, the deserts, jams, the goat cheese, etc. It is all heavenly. Ever heard of olive jam? Wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel when in Siwa.
reviews.title: What an experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had four excellent nights in this beautiful and simpathetically constructed hotel adjacent to the Shali Fortress in central Siwa. The location was wonderful as was the service. The Siwan people were wonderful and the hotel staff were no exception - nothing was too much to ask. A genuinely refreshing change to the agressive touting of Cairo and the Nile Valley. The restaurant on the roof of the Albabenshal is also a magnificent location to enjoy an evening meal from what is probably the most extensive menu in town. Definitely recommended!
reviews.title: Romantic peaceful and relaxing stay in the ancient Shali fort in Siwa Oasis

reviews.text: After the bustle of Cairo, spending four days in Siwa, and Albabenshal in particular, was an absolute paradise.
reviews.title: A delightful place to stay!

reviews.text: We arrived at Albabenshal late in the evening after an exhausting bus journey from Cairo. Our bags were swiftly taken away from us and we were ushered to the terrace for complimentary drinks. It was such a relaxed atmosphere; we didn't even formally check in til a day or two later.
reviews.title: speechless

reviews.text: Overlooking the town's main square and in the grounds of Shali fortress, Albabenshal has a great location. The rooms are cool and tastefully decorated. It also has a restaurant, serving very good and reasonably priced traditional Siwan food. The added bonus is that you can eat on the terrace, with a lovely view of the town and the atmospherically lit fortress. The staff are genuinely friendly (and not fishing for tips).
reviews.title: Great experience, great value

likes.liked: — Location, fascinating structure, value for money
likes.disliked: — Central market square location made it a little noisy at night

description: Albabenshal Heritage Lodge is located directly outside the entrance of the historic Fortress of Shali. The architecture of the lodge is modeled after the original structures that once filled the great fortress. Albabenshal offers 11 Rooms on three levels connected through a network of alleyways and terraces that overlook the center of town on one side and the great Fortress on the other.
